result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Matthew Gamble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONDITIONS OF PROBATION APPLY TO BOTH COUNTS.

miscConds.notes: Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. No contact direct or indirect with A.S.

To pay the costs of the action, including court appointed attorney costs. Cash bond applied. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: To perform  20  hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency per year of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon M Gamble in court.  Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court for Brandon M Gamble. Minute sheet. State moves to amend Ct.1. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts.3 and amended Ct.1. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Cts.3 and amended Ct.1. State/Defense join in sentence recommendation, make statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon M Gamble in court.  Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court for Brandon M Gamble. Court questions where matter is at.  Atty Pribyl indicates should resolve with a global resolution, requests plea/sentencing in 60 days.  Bond remains in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Court reminds defendant of monthly attorney fee payments.  Bond remains in effect.

8:45 AM   Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon Matthew Gamble in court.  Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court for Brandon Matthew Gamble.   Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 11:40 am.

Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  Bond remains in effect.

Order to Modify Bond

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release.  Alcohol Monitoring - High Level.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Converted to cash bond.

Court addresses State's motion to modify defendant's signature bond to a cash bond.  DA Nordin makes statement on bond modification. Court amends signature bond to $500 cash bond. Court modifies PTR monitoring condition from drug monitoring to alcohol monitoring - high level.  All other conditions remain as previously set.

1:00 PM Defendant Brandon Matthew Gamble appeared by video from the Door County Jail, Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Court questions defendant on whether he's contacted SPD office regarding legal representation. Defendant indicates he did not qualify but his circumstances have changed so he may now qualify.  Clerk advises of email from SPD regarding legal representation: "Mr. Gamble did not qualify with us yesterday, he says his circumstances have changed but we will be needing verification of that.  So Attorney Viel will not be appearing with him today".    Court encourages defendant to get verification needed to SPD so they can determine if he qualifies or not and if he does, get counsel appointed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:30 am. Brandon M. Gamble appears via video from the Door County Jail.  Nicholas Grode appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant indicates he tried contacting SPD but didn't get to talk to anyone.   State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Court encourages defendant to contact SPD before next hearing to see if he qualifies or not.   Return  2/28/22 at 10:00 am.
